title: Most of the land is low-lying
description: In 2015, 81.7% of the Marshall Islands' land area was below 5 meters in elevation, making it one of the most low-lying countries in the world.

title: High incidence of tuberculosis
description: In 2023, the Marshall Islands had an incidence of tuberculosis of 692 cases per 100,000 people, one of the highest rates globally.

title: High external health expenditure per capita
description: In 2022, the Marshall Islands had an external health expenditure per capita of $455.51, one of the highest in the world.

title: Minimal nitrous oxide emissions
description: In 2023, the Marshall Islands had one of the lowest nitrous oxide emissions globally, with a total of 0.0002 Mt CO2e.
